conclusion: The volume of the gas at state A is \( V_A = V_0 \), and the temperature at state A is \( T_A = T_0 \).
The volume of the gas at state B is \( V_B = 2V_0 \), and the temperature at state B is \( T_B = T_0 \).
The temperature at state C is \( T_C \).
The volume of the gas at state C is \( V_C = V_B - V_A = 2V_0 - V_0 = V_0 \).
The temperature at state C is \( T_C \).
The temperature at state C is the same as the temperature at state A, since the volume of the gas at state C is the same as the volume of the gas at state A.
Therefore, the temperature at state C is \( T_C = T_0 \).
